revised_title: Temperature Variations in the Human Head
tldr: The author conducted a series of experiments to measure the temperature variations in different regions of the human head. They divided the head into tiers and districts and compared the temperature differences between symmetrically situated spaces on both sides. The results showed that the mean difference of temperature varied between different regions and sides of the head, with the left side generally having a slightly higher temperature. The study provides insights into the temperature regulation and physiology of the human body.
